welcome to another one of my video

we're gonna troubleshoot a desk lamp
here when we arrived at our place here
in Costa Rica
this lamp worked just fine so what went
wrong well first of course the most
obvious thing is to check is the light
bulb and I changed the bulb and still no
functio 'no on this one so let's try and
swap it with one that we absolutely know
works you never know when you get a bad
bulb so we'll switch the one out of the
bad lamp put it in the one we know works
and it does and the one we know was
working still nothing so we're plugged
into the same outlet I guess you can
always try that because sometimes and
this is actually a good tip lots of
times in homes you're gonna find that
half of the outlets are switched and
half is hot all the time half is on a
wall switch so just to make sure that's
not the case here which I know it isn't
but what you want to do is swap them and
then you're sure
so we've swapped the lamps and that one
still works in that outlet and this one
doesn't so what we've got to do is take
this lamp apart find out what went wrong
so one thing you want to do is examine
the socket inside of the lamp here now
you can see this point right in there
that makes contact with the center of
the bulb that's your hot and this is
your neutral that touches the shell of
the light bulb itself one thing I notice
here I don't see any burnt points like
lots of times you'll find that
rivet down here on the on the center pin
is corroded so that can cause you
problems that's one thing to check the
center pin should also have some spring
to it not be all soft and malleable but
this is good it's spring steel and here
make sure that there's no corrosion on
what makes contact with the shell of the
ball for the neutral all that seems good
in this one but I did notice the socket
is loose so if you look right down in
here there's a Philips and a standard
blade screw head machine screw head
that's loose so we're just gonna tighten
that up a little and that makes the
socket nice and tighten there we'll bend
it back to the center position Sol
that's not the problem we're going to
take the base off this lamp and see if
something went wrong with the switch so
again with the lamp unplugged as you can
see there's three screw holes here that
just hold this plastic base on remove
those got them all loosened up take the
base off and have a look and right away
I see what the problem is let me bring
you in for a close-up of this so here's
the rocker switch that turns this lamp
on and off you'll notice on the other
one it's an inline lamp cord switch that
operates it but this one's got a switch
on the base well as soon as I pulled
that base off you can see what the
problem is this is just a simple single
pole switch single pull rocker switch
and this brown wire was popped right off
of a terminal of the switch Sol the
neutral is carried right on through to
the lamp socket and it's fine but we've
got a resaw der that wire on to that
there you go that little terminal or
right there and once we do that I'm sure
this lamp will work so I just need to
add a little bit of solder to these
connections I've got my iron nice and
hot here you'll see I'm just gonna touch
the solder to the tip make sure that
it's hot enough to melt solder and it is
so there's probably some residual solder
left on the terminal but I'll add a
little bit anyway so what you want to do
is touch your iron down to the wire and
the terminal and they need to both get
hot enough to you'll see the solder flow
into the terminal when things are hard
enough and I'll touch up the other
terminal as well too much there you
don't want too much solder just enough
to just enough to flow into the wire and
the terminal there I saw it saw it flow
into the terminal I think that's about
as close as I can get that shot blow on
it cool it off a little bit and I see
that switches a little bit loose in
there but I have a good solder job
between the wire and the terminal so now
that I've got my soldering complete you
can see it's all nice and tight on that
terminal and that one's good now before
I put the base on I'm just gonna test
the lamp and make sure it works then
we'll put it all back together so I
haven't put the base back on yet just in
case there's still something wrong but
let's test our lamp oh and it works as
it should and the other one's working so
we can put that base back on and we've
saved ourselves a few bucks it's not an
expensive lamp but in this day and age

how simple it can be to repair something
